So like, if anyone doesn't know there are these things called "Lucid Dreams" and basically, it means that you can control every aspect of your dream. TRG dream every night? Done. Unlimited amounts of pizza that you can ACTUALLY TASTE? If u want to. Studies have proven that your mind is MORE active during lucid dreams than when you're ACTUALLY awake. This means that instead of your dreams being foggy and forgettable, they can be really really vivid and incredible! Do what u waaaant.

*Writing down your dreams whenever you remember them is important. This will make ALL of your dreams more memorable. The more you write down, the more you'll remember
*During your lucid dreams, you can ASK your subconscious a question like "yoo what's my greatest fear" or "yoo what does this nightmare mean?" or "yoooOOO show me something that I would find ABSOLUTELY HILARIOUS" You know, like, stuff you couldn't figure out by yourself.
*Once you learn that lucid dreams are real, you are 243x more likely to actually have one
*Some people are born with the ability to lucid dream every night without effort. Fucking pricks.
*don't look into mirrors when you dream. Nothing good ever happens.
*flying dreams are cool

You actually, on average, have about four dreams per night because you have four REM cycles (rapid eye movement). You aren't likely to REMEMBER the first two parts of your REM cycle. If you wake up during these cycles, they will most likely seem the foggiest, or most forgettable. the third and fourth are the longest and MOST vivid. These are the optimal times to become lucid in your dreams because you would be more likely to remember them

*While it does take effort, the best way to lucid dream is to wake up early, then lie in bed quietly without moving for about 30 minutes.
*If you are attempting this, you have to silence your inner monologue and try your best to focus on your breathing for a while. Eventually you will feel your body fall asleep. This may be indicated by your nose itching or feeling the need to roll over. This is your mind checking to make sure your body is asleep. If your body doesn't physically respond, you will begin the sleep cycle.
*If you wake up early, you will most likely wake up during your third or fourth REM cycle. Then, when you perform this technique, you will be going from a waking state right into a dream state. :O
